Code Documentation¶

copper.py¶

This is the core module of Copper. It handles the following:

  • Curves
  • Sets of curves
  • Equipment related calculations
  • Unit conversions
  • Genetic algorithm
  • Curve library manipulations
class copper.copper.Chiller(ref_cap, ref_cap_unit, full_eff, full_eff_unit, part_eff, part_eff_unit, compressor_type, condenser_type, compressor_speed, set_of_curves='', model='ect_lwt', sim_engine='energyplus')[source]¶

Bases: object

calc_eff(eff_type, unit='kw/ton')[source]¶

Calculate chiller efficiency.

Parameters:
  • eff_type (str) – Chiller performance indicator, currently supported kw/ton (full load rating) and iplv (part load rating)
  • unit (str) – Unit of the efficiency indicator
Returns:

Chiller performance indicator
Return type:

float
generate_set_of_curves(method='typical', pop_size=100, tol=0.005, max_gen=15000, vars='', sFac=0.5, retain=0.2, random_select=0.3, mutate=0.8, bounds=(6, 10))[source]¶

Generate a set of curves for a particular Chiller() object.

Parameters:
  • method (str) –

    Method used to generate the set of curves, either typical or best_match

    • typical uses typical curves and modify them to reach a particular IPLV
    • best_match uses curves that best match the chiller object description
  • pop_size (int) – Population size used by the genetic algorithm
  • tol (float) – Tolerance used by the genetic algorithm to determine if the proposed solution is acceptable The lower, the more stringent
  • max_gen (int) – Maximum number of generation
  • vars (list()) – List of variable to run the alorithm on
  • sFac (float) – Linear fitness normalization factor, the higher the more aggressive the normalization will be
  • retain (float) – Probability of retaining an individual in the next generation
  • random_select (float) – Probability of randomly selecting an individual to be part of the next generation
  • mutate (float) – Probability of an individual to be mutated in the next generation
  • bounds (tuple()) – Random modification bounds (TODO: add more details)
Returns:

Set of curves object generated by the genetic algorithm that matches the Chiller() definition
Return type:

SetofCurves()

scale_fitnesses(fitnesses, pop, scaling=True)[source]¶

Scale the fitness scores to prevent best performers from dragging the whole population to a local extremum.

Parameters:
  • fitnesses (list()) – List of fitness for each set of curves
  • pop (list()) – List of sets of curves
  • scaling (boolean) – Specifies whether of not to linearly scale the fitnesses
Returns:

List of tuples representing the fitness of a set of curves and the set of curves
Return type:

list(tuple())

Bases: object

content()[source]¶
find_equipment(filters=[])[source]¶

Find equipment matching specified filter in the curve library.

Special filter characters:

  • ~! means “all except…”
  • ! means “do not include…”
  • ~ means “include…”
Parameters:filters (list(tuple())) – Filter represented by tuples (field, val)
Returns:Dictionary of field for each equipment matching specified filter
Return type:dict[str,dict[]]

  • eqp – Equipment object(e.g. Chiller())
Returns:

Set of curves object
Return type:

plot(out_var=[], axes=[], norm=True, color='Black', alpha=0.3)[source]¶

Plot set of curves.

Parameters:
  • out_var (list()) – List of the output variables to plot, e.g. eir-f-t, eir-f-plr, cap-f-t. Refer to JSON files structure for other output variables
  • axes (matplotlib.pyplot.axes) – Matplotlib pyplot axes
  • norm (boolean) – Normalize plot to reference values
  • color (str) – Set of curves color
  • alpha (float) – Transparency of the curves (0-1).
Returns:

Plotting success
Return type:

boolean
